intro: Trachelanthus, commonly known as the "trachy" or "desert star," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are usually reduced or absent, with the photosynthetic function largely taken over by the stems. Trachelanthus species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environments through various survival mechanisms. These plants are often used in traditional medicine and have ornamental value due to their unique appearance.
